intro: Parmentiera millspaughiana, commonly known as the Mexican moonflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and Central America. It is a member of the Bignoniaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that open at night. The plant produces long, cylindrical fruit that contains numerous seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in dry, rocky soils. The Mexican moonflower is also known for its fragrant blooms and is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes.
